text: How do you know when you have the longest factorization string for a number? How does using exponents make clear the number of factors in the factor string?

Students might respond with understandings such as the following:

  • Exponents shorten the string of numbers being multiplied by combining the same factors into shorter notation. For example, 3 × 3 × 3 × 3 × 3 = 35.
  • Numbers can be broken down (decomposed) into factor strings. When the strings start to repeat factors, exponents help to write the expression.
